alert.note: Alert for Owens Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 11 at 11:56AM PST until March 12 at 4:00AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .Accelerated snow melt coupled with recent heavy rains and relatively mild winds will lead to increased flows in washes and rivers. Drainage basins may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following areas, Eastern Sierra Slopes and Owens Valley. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
